name: Announcements
description: Access information about announcements and post announcements.

deleteannouncement(string,string).name: deleteAnnouncement
deleteannouncement(string,string).signature: public static void deleteAnnouncement(String communityId, String announcementId)
deleteannouncement(string,string).overrideSignature: public static override void deleteAnnouncement(String communityId, String announcementId)

announcementid.name: announcementId
announcementid.description: Use either the ID for a community, internal, or null. An announcement ID, which has a prefix of 0BT.

getannouncement(string,string).name: getAnnouncement
getannouncement(string,string).signature: public static ConnectApi.Announcement getAnnouncement(String communityId, String announcementId)
getannouncement(string,string).overrideSignature: public static override ConnectApi.Announcement getAnnouncement(String communityId, String announcementId)

announcementid.name: announcementId
announcementid.description: Use either the ID for a community, internal, or null. An announcement ID, which has a prefix of 0BT.

getannouncements(string,string).name: getAnnouncements
getannouncements(string,string).signature: public static ConnectApi.AnnouncementPage getAnnouncements(String communityId, String parentId)
getannouncements(string,string).overrideSignature: public static override ConnectApi.AnnouncementPage getAnnouncements(String communityId, String parentId)
getannouncements(string,string).description: Get the first page of announcements.

parentid.name: parentId
parentid.description: Use either the ID for a community, internal, or null. ID of the parent entity for the announcement, that is, a group ID when the announcement appears in a group.

getannouncements(string,string,integer,i.name: getAnnouncements
getannouncements(string,string,integer,i.signature: public static ConnectApi.AnnouncementPage getAnnouncements(String communityId, String parentId, Integer pageParam, Integer pageSize)
getannouncements(string,string,integer,i.overrideSignature: public static override ConnectApi.AnnouncementPage getAnnouncements(String communityId, String parentId, Integer pageParam, Integer pageSize)

pagesize.name: pageSize
pagesize.description: Use either the ID for a community, internal, or null. ID of the parent entity for the announcement, that is, a group ID when the announcement appears in a group. Specifies the number of the page you want returned. Starts at 0. If you pass in null or 0, the first page is returned. Specifies the number of announcements per page.

postannouncement(string,connectapi.annou.name: postAnnouncement
postannouncement(string,connectapi.annou.signature: public static ConnectApi.Announcement postAnnouncement(String communityId, ConnectApi.AnnouncementInput announcement)
postannouncement(string,connectapi.annou.overrideSignature: public static override ConnectApi.Announcement postAnnouncement(String communityId, ConnectApi.AnnouncementInput announcement)

announcement.name: announcement
announcement.description: Use either the ID for a community, internal, or null. A ConnectApi.AnnouncementInput object.

updateannouncement(string,string,datetim.name: updateAnnouncement
updateannouncement(string,string,datetim.signature: public static ConnectApi.Announcement updateAnnouncement(String communityId, String announcementId, Datetime expirationDate)
updateannouncement(string,string,datetim.overrideSignature: public static override ConnectApi.Announcement updateAnnouncement(String communityId, String announcementId, Datetime expirationDate)
updateannouncement(string,string,datetim.description: Update the expiration date of an announcement.

expirationdate.name: expirationDate
expirationdate.description: Use either the ID for a community, internal, or null. An announcement ID, which has a prefix of 0BT. The Salesforce UI displays an announcement until 11:59 p.m. on this date unless another announcement is posted first. The Salesforce UI ignores the time value in the expirationDate. However, you can use the time value to create your own display logic in your own UI.
